item.title: Post: ubuntu-wsl
item.description: And when I do get home and start playing with inbox/WSL 2, I’ll make sure to install the ubuntu-wsl package. Among the highlights: – wslusc – WSL shortcut creator placed on Windows 10 desktop wslsys – WSL system information wslfetch – terminal based system info (think Neofetch) wslvar – get Windows system environment variables wslview – open link in default Windows browser uh i mean when it shows up on the slow ring
item.content:encoded:
And when I do get home and start playing with inbox/WSL 2, I’ll make sure to install the ubuntu-wsl package.

Among the highlights: –

  • wslusc – WSL shortcut creator placed on Windows 10 desktop
  • wslsys – WSL system information
  • wslfetch – terminal based system info (think Neofetch)
  • wslvar – get Windows system environment variables
  • wslview – open link in default Windows browser

uh i mean when it shows up on the slow ring

not “when i get home”

awkward cough
